news.title: 360 ONE real assets platform raises ₹2,300 crore
news.para: In a remarkable feat, 360 ONE Asset's real assets platform has amassed ₹2,300 crore within just four months, showcasing its strong appeal to investors. This fund primarily focuses on acquiring infrastructure and income-generating commercial ventures.

news.title: Concorde invests ₹125 crore to develop commercial block at Concorde Mayfair in Bengaluru
news.para: Bengaluru's Concorde has invested ₹125 crore to develop a commercial block at Concorde Mayfair. This new development in Yelahanka will feature retail spaces and office units.

news.title: Income tax department conducts searches at Brigade Enterprises' premises
news.para: Brigade Enterprises shares dropped after the Income Tax Department conducted search operations. The searches concluded recently. The company stated its operations are unaffected. Analysts maintain a strong buy rating with a significant target price. The company recently acquired land in Hyderabad. Brigade Enterprises reported strong September quarter results with increased profit and revenue.

news.title: Capital Gateway homebuyers protest delay in Gurugram, seek probe into regulatory lapses
news.para: Hundreds of homebuyers protested prolonged delays and regulatory lapses at the Capital Gateway housing project in Gurugram.  Allottees are urging HRERA to review project approvals and ensure strict enforcement of RERA provisions, demanding clarity on completion timelines and accountability from the developer.

news.title: Maharashtra weighs separate policy for freehold plots conversion in Nagpur
news.para: Maharashtra Minister Shambhuraj Desai indicated a separate policy is needed for converting rent or lease plots to freehold across the state, following a discussion on Nagpur's 9,000 town planning and 61,827 NIT plots. This move could grant ownership rights to lakhs of residents. A meeting with concerned departments and MLAs will be convened to discuss the policy's framework.

news.title: YEIDA to prepare future-ready service master plan
news.para: YEIDA is hiring a consultant to create a comprehensive service master plan for water supply, sewerage, and stormwater drainage. This plan will assess current infrastructure, identify gaps, and outline a roadmap for future development and integration with Master Plan 2041, ensuring the region's growth is supported by robust utility systems.

news.title: AAI's high-frequency radar to be relocated, will unlock land for affordable housing in Dahisar: Aviation minister
news.para: Dahisar, Mumbai is set to unveil vast tracts of land dedicated to affordable housing solutions. By relocating the Airports Authority of India's radar to Gorai, the region opens its gates to thousands of new homes. This vital redevelopment will breathe new life into aging buildings, fostering improved living standards and economic vitality.

news.title: GRAP IV restrictions go up in smoke, Gurugram chokes on dust as building sites flout norms
news.para: Gurugram's air quality plummets as construction sites flout pollution control norms under GRAP stage 4 restrictions. Despite a ban, many sites continue operations without basic dust mitigation, leaving residents gasping for breath amidst a pervasive haze. Authorities claim action, but visible dust and non-compliance paint a grim picture.

news.title: Noida authority to have database of illegal buildings
news.para: Noida Authority is creating online databases for illegal constructions and demolitions to prevent fraud in property purchases.  The initiative aims to protect homebuyers from financial losses and demolition threats.  The Authority has already cleared significant encroached land and is installing warning boards on reclaimed plots.

news.title: Ahmedabad builder pays ₹103.5 crore for additional FSI to construct 38-storey highrise in Thaltej
news.para: A builder paid a record Rs 103.50 crore for additional FSI to construct a 38-storey residential project, signaling a surge in luxury high-rise demand. This significant approval, driven by high jantri rates and relaxed norms, will see four towers with heights up to 127.7m, offering 250 units.

news.title: Bhopal now ceding realty projects ground to Ujjain: Madhya Pradesh RERA report
news.para: Major real estate projects are shifting from Bhopal to Ujjain, the Chief Minister's hometown, with Ujjain now registering more projects than the state capital. Builders cite the upcoming Ujjain Simhastha and the CM's connection as reasons, while Bhopal's development is hampered by an outdated master plan. Indore remains the leading city for project registrations.

news.title: China Vanke bondholders reject payment extension, raising default risk
news.para: China Vanke's bondholders have rejected a crucial extension request, elevating the company's risk of default. This development ignites fresh fears regarding the stability of the country’s property industry. With 2 billion yuan at stake and a limited grace period looming, Vanke's efforts to secure credit-enhanced proposals also failed to garner support.

news.title: China's home prices slide further in November
news.para: China's housing market is grappling with persistent sluggishness, as evidenced by a decline in new home prices throughout November. This trend, deepening from prior downturns, makes it clear that the appetite for property is still low, despite governmental commitments to foster stability.

news.title: Odisha govt notifies amendments to stamp rules, will help streamline property valuation
news.para: Odisha has updated its stamp duty rules to ensure fairer property valuations and boost transparency. New guidelines will use plot-wise market data and average auction prices in cities, moving away from inflated figures. Property values will be revised every two years, with urban areas seeing a 5% increase annually. Building valuations will now consider construction stage and materials used.

news.title: Pune: NGT allows construction at Baner project, but orders monitoring by MPCB
news.para: The National Green Tribunal has permitted construction to resume at a Baner real estate project, mandating Maharashtra Pollution Control Board (MPCB) monitoring for noise and dust pollution. The MPCB will assess the site within a week and determine if past violations warrant environmental damage compensation, while the Pune Municipal Corporation must establish construction pollution protocols.

news.title: Land acquisition issues nearing closure in Andhra Pradesh capital region villages
news.para: Capital region farmers' land acquisition issues are nearing resolution, with most of the 47 pending cases expected to be finalized within a week. Infrastructure development in capital villages is set to accelerate, as detailed project reports for 29 villages are being prepared. Pension for landless poor has been reinstated, benefiting thousands.

news.title: NDMC launches cleanliness drive across key residential, commercial zones
news.para: The New Delhi Municipal Council is igniting a transformation with its latest cleanliness campaign. Different departments are uniting efforts to sweep away dust, remove silt, and elevate the beauty of green areas. This initiative specifically targets high-traffic residential and commercial zones, striving to minimize pollution and improve public health.

news.title: No permit fee for small plots in Uttar Pradesh
news.para: Uttar Pradesh government has waived building permit and inspection fees for residential plots under 1,076 sqft and small shops under 323 sqft. Amended byelaws now grant deemed approval for construction on these plots via an online platform. Revisions also broaden definitions of floor area ratio and layout plans, promoting vertical growth and updating building descriptions.

news.title: Odisha REAT upholds ORERA order requiring builder to obtain OC, transfer common areas
news.para: OREAT has ruled against a city realtor's challenge to an ORERA order, highlighting the importance of compliance in real estate development. The tribunal has required the promoter to secure completion and occupancy certificates for the 41-duplex project located in Janla.

news.title: Pride Hotels targets IPO by March 2026 to fund renovations
news.para: Pride Hotels is gearing up for an IPO scheduled for March 2026, fueling its ambition to revamp its existing properties while also focusing on debt reduction. This strategic move aligns with its plan to broaden its reach by launching new hotels in key business areas, popular leisure destinations, and spiritual hubs.
